sections.summary: The 'Recession Oracle'. The difference between the 10-Year and 2-Year US Treasury yields. An 'Inverted' curve has preceded every recession.
sections.deep_dive: The 10Y-2Y spread is the roadmap for the business cycle. In 2026, the focus has shifted from the 'Inversion' to the 'Un-inversion'. Historically, the recession does not start when the curve inverts, but when it 'Un-inverts' because the Fed is rapidly cutting rates in response to a crisis. An inverted curve is 'Economic Poison' because it destroys the business model of banks: they borrow short and lend long. If it's inverted, they stop lending. This indicator is the definitive signal for the end of a growth regime. For macro traders, the first day of 'Bull Steepening' is the signal that the 'Hard Landing' has finally arrived.

council_debate.macro: Reflects the Fed's 'Tightness'. Deep inversion means the Fed has gone too far and has likely broken something.
council_debate.policy: The Fed's nemesis. They want to maintain a 'Positive Slope' to ensure the banking system functions correctly.
council_debate.quant: The 'Carry-to-Basis' quants move into short-term paper and cash during deep inversion to preserve capital.
council_debate.technical: The 0.00 line (Zero) is the most important support level. Crossing back above it starts the recession clock.
council_debate.geopolitics: Foreign central banks use the curve slope to determine the attractiveness of US 'Long-Bond' holdings versus gold.
council_debate.tech: AI-driven liquidity management has allowed some banks to survive longer inversions than in the past.

sections.forecast_risks: The 'Soft Landing Illusion': Staying inverted for 36 months without a recession, only to have a total systemic collapse when it un-inverts.
